dxy.name: US Dollar Index (DXY)
dxy.description: Dollar vs a basket of major fiat currencies (euro-heavy). Rising = dollar strengthening, falling = dollar weakening. A relative measure: if all currencies debase together, DXY stays flat.

eurusd.name: EUR/USD
eurusd.description: Euro vs dollar. DXY's largest component (~58%). Rising = dollar weakening, falling = dollar strengthening.

usdcny.name: USD/CNY
usdcny.description: Dollar-yuan exchange rate. Rising = yuan weakening, falling = yuan strengthening. Below 7.00 signals meaningful capital flow shift toward China.

usdjpy.name: USD/JPY
usdjpy.description: Dollar-yen exchange rate. Rising = yen weakening (carry trade expanding, risk-on). Falling = yen strengthening (carry trade unwinding, risk-off). Sharp yen rallies can trigger global liquidation cascades as leveraged carry positions unwind.

usd_reserves_share.name: USD Share of FX Reserves
usd_reserves_share.description: USD share of global foreign-exchange reserves held by central banks (IMF COFER, quarterly, ~1 Q lag). Falling = structural de-dollarization. Down from 72 % in 2000 to ~57 %: slow-moving but largely irreversible.

us_10y.name: US 10Y Yield
us_10y.name_zh: 美国十年期国债收益率
us_10y.description: Benchmark Treasury yield. Rising = market demanding more compensation to hold US debt. Above 5% is a yellow flag, above 6% likely forces Fed intervention.

yield_curve.name: 10Y-2Y Spread
yield_curve.description: 10Y minus 2Y Treasury yield: measures yield curve steepness. Positive and rising = curve steepening (long-end yields rising faster, often signaling inflation expectations or fiscal stress). Inverted (negative) = market pricing rate cuts. Re-steepening after inversion historically precedes recessions within 6-18 months.

tips_5y.name: US 5Y TIPS (Real Yield)
tips_5y.description: Real cost of money after inflation. Rising = tighter real conditions, falling = looser. Negative real yields push capital toward gold and hard assets.

breakeven_10y.name: 10Y Breakeven Inflation
breakeven_10y.name_zh: 十年期盈亏平衡通胀率
breakeven_10y.description: Market-implied inflation expectation for the next 10 years. Rising = market pricing higher inflation, falling = disinflation expectations.

jp_10y.name: Japan 10Y Yield
jp_10y.description: Japan 10-year government bond yield. BOJ was the last holdout on ultra-loose policy. Rising JGB yields → Japanese investors repatriate capital from US/EU bonds → global liquidity tightening. Above 1% is a sea change for the world’s largest creditor nation.

cn_10y.name: China 10Y Yield
cn_10y.description: China 10-year government bond yield. Falling = PBOC easing, deflation risk. Rising = growth expectations improving. The US-China spread drives capital flows.

hy_spread.name: HY Credit Spread (OAS)
hy_spread.description: High-yield bond spread over Treasuries. Widening = credit stress / risk-off. Tight = complacency. Above 5% signals recession risk. Leading indicator: when the Fed tightens or liquidity dries up, HY spreads blow out before equities sell off.

fed_balance_sheet.name: Fed Balance Sheet
fed_balance_sheet.description: Total assets held by the Federal Reserve. Rising = QE / liquidity injection, falling = QT / tightening. Treasury market stress forces re-expansion.

debt_to_gdp.name: US Debt/GDP
debt_to_gdp.description: Federal debt as a share of GDP. Rising = fiscal trajectory worsening. If GDP grows faster than debt, the ratio stabilizes; otherwise compounding takes over.

tga.name: Treasury General Account
tga.description: US government's checking account at the Fed. Drawdowns inject liquidity into markets (bullish for risk assets). Refills drain liquidity.

rrp.name: ON RRP Usage
rrp.description: Cash parked at the Fed's overnight reverse repo facility. High = excess liquidity sloshing around. Draining toward zero = liquidity cushion gone, markets more fragile. Peaked at ~$2.6T in late 2022, now near zero.

reserve_balances.name: Reserve Balances
reserve_balances.description: Bank reserves held at the Fed. Below ~$3T historically triggers repo stress. The floor for 'ample reserves' regime: when reserves get scarce, the Fed is forced to stop QT or restart lending facilities.

gold.name: Gold
gold.description: Spot gold price. Rising = inflation hedge demand / loss of confidence in fiat. Central banks buying gold = voting to diversify away from dollars.

silver.name: Silver
silver.description: Both monetary and industrial metal (solar, electronics). Market in structural deficit. Outperforms gold in bull runs, more volatile.

copper.name: Copper
copper.description: Electrification bellwether: EVs, data centers, wind turbines, grid upgrades. Supply structurally constrained (mines take 7-15 years). Rising = industrial and green demand outpacing supply.

aluminum.name: Aluminum
aluminum.description: Aluminum futures. The most China-sensitive industrial metal (~60% of global production). Proxy for Chinese industrial activity and global construction/infrastructure demand.

uranium.name: Uranium (URA ETF)
uranium.description: Global X Uranium ETF. Proxy for nuclear renaissance: 30+ countries committed to tripling capacity. Supply constrained, Russia controls 40% of enrichment.

remx.name: Rare Earth ETF (REMX)
remx.description: VanEck Rare Earth/Strategic Metals ETF. Proxy for rare earth supply chain. China controls ~70% of processing. Critical for EV motors, wind turbines, defense, and AI hardware.

oil.name: WTI Crude
oil.description: WTI crude futures. Rising = supply tightening or demand growth. Politically suppressed via Saudi deals and SPR releases, but geological supply constraints persist.

brent.name: Brent Crude
brent.description: Brent crude futures — the global oil benchmark. OPEC+ prices off Brent, not WTI. More geopolitically relevant: Middle East tensions, Russia sanctions, and tanker route disruptions show up here first.

natgas.name: Natural Gas
natgas.description: Henry Hub natural gas futures. Rising = tightening supply or seasonal/structural demand. AI data centers driving new electricity demand. Also a geopolitical commodity (Russia/Europe, LNG).

energy_cpi.name: Energy Services CPI YoY
energy_cpi.description: Year-over-year change in energy services prices (BLS). Rising = energy inflation accelerating. Directly tied to AI data center power demand. Above 7% creates political backlash.

sp500.name: S&P 500
sp500.description: Broad US equity benchmark. Rising = risk-on, falling = risk-off. Compare with QQQ/SMH to gauge whether tech is leading or lagging.

djia.name: Dow Jones
djia.description: Dow Jones Industrial Average — 30 blue-chip, old-economy-heavy stocks. When Dow outperforms QQQ, market is rotating from tech into industrials/real economy.

qqq.name: Nasdaq 100 ETF (QQQ)
qqq.description: 100 largest Nasdaq non-financial companies. AI/tech-heavy (Mag7 dominant). QQQ vs SMH divergence signals whether AI leadership is rotating.

iwm.name: Russell 2000 ETF (IWM)
iwm.description: iShares Russell 2000 ETF — US small-cap proxy. Most rate-sensitive part of the market. Small-cap strength = domestic economic confidence; weakness = credit stress hitting Main Street.

smh.name: Semiconductor ETF (SMH)
smh.description: VanEck Semiconductor ETF: Nvidia, TSMC, ASML. The AI picks-and-shovels trade. SMH underperforming QQQ = leadership rotating from chip builders to enablers/adopters.

xlu.name: Utilities ETF (XLU)
xlu.description: Utilities sector ETF. Data centers need massive electricity: XLU outperforming tech = market rotating into AI infrastructure over AI hype.

gsci_spy_ratio.name: Commodities / S&P 500
gsci_spy_ratio.description: GSG/SPY ratio: real assets vs financial assets. Rising = commodities outperforming equities. Turning up from decades-long lows.

vix.name: VIX
vix.description: S&P 500 implied volatility. Below 15 = complacency, above 25 = fear, above 35 = panic. Spikes tend to be short-lived but can signal regime shifts.

btc.name: Bitcoin
btc.description: Digital debasement hedge. Correlates with global liquidity: central bank balance sheet expansion = BTC tailwind. Also a barometer of risk appetite.

cb_gold_buying.name: Central Bank Gold Buying
cb_gold_buying.description: Trailing 12-month net purchases by central banks (World Gold Council). Structural shift post-2022: ~1,000 t/yr vs ~300–650 pre-2022. Rising = de-dollarization demand.

csi300.name: CSI 300
csi300.description: China's benchmark equity index (top 300 A-shares). Rising = domestic and foreign capital returning to Chinese markets.

hsi.name: Hang Seng Index
hsi.description: Hong Kong's benchmark: the offshore window into Chinese equities. More sensitive to global capital flows and foreign sentiment than onshore CSI 300.

kweb.name: China Internet ETF (KWEB)
kweb.description: KraneShares China Internet ETF: Alibaba, Tencent, PDD, etc. Rising = foreign confidence in Chinese tech improving.

china_pmi.name: China Mfg PMI
china_pmi.description: NBS Manufacturing PMI. Above 50 = expansion, below 50 = contraction. Sustained above 51 confirms recovery; below 49 signals deepening weakness.

china_retail_sales.name: China Retail Sales YoY
china_retail_sales.description: Monthly YoY growth in Chinese retail sales (NBS). Rising = consumer recovery gaining traction. Needs to sustain 4%+ to confirm consumption pivot.

eem.name: MSCI Emerging Markets ETF (EEM)
eem.description: Broad EM equity benchmark. Rising = capital flowing into developing markets. EM outperforming DM = dollar weakness + fragmentation trade working.

inda.name: India ETF (INDA)
inda.description: iShares MSCI India ETF. Tracks large and mid-cap Indian equities. India is the fastest-growing major economy with strong demographics and manufacturing push (Make in India).

ilf.name: Latin America ETF (ILF)
ilf.description: iShares Latin America 40 ETF. Tracks Brazil, Mexico, Chile, Colombia. Commodity-rich region benefiting from nearshoring (Mexico) and resource nationalism.

china_cpi.name: China CPI YoY
china_cpi.description: Year-over-year change in China consumer prices. Negative = deflation risk, the #1 macro worry for China bulls. Sustained positive CPI needed to confirm reflation thesis.

china_gdp.name: China GDP YoY
china_gdp.description: China real GDP year-over-year growth rate. Headline execution metric for the 15-year plan. Target ~5%. Sustained above-target growth validates the re-rating thesis.

china_m2.name: China M2 YoY
china_m2.description: China broad money supply year-over-year growth. M2 > 10% = PBOC actively stimulating. Rising M2 is a leading indicator for credit impulse and asset reflation.

china_mktcap_gdp.name: China Market Cap / GDP
china_mktcap_gdp.description: Total market cap of Shanghai + Shenzhen exchanges as % of nominal GDP. China's version of the Buffett Indicator. Currently ~70%: far below US (~350%) and below its own 2015 peak (~100%). Low = room for re-rating.

move.name: MOVE Index
move.description: ICE BofA MOVE Index: Treasury market implied volatility across 2Y-30Y maturities. The bond market's VIX. Above 120 = elevated stress, above 150 = potential basis trade unwinds and forced Fed intervention.

us_ism_pmi.name: US Manufacturing PMI (ISM)
us_ism_pmi.description: ISM Manufacturing PMI: the oldest US manufacturing indicator. Above 50 = expansion, below 50 = contraction. Sustained expansion signals onshoring and supply chain diversification.
us_ism_pmi.note: Monthly — ISM (no free API, backfill from CSV)

us_gdp.name: US Real GDP Growth
us_gdp.description: Real GDP growth rate (SAAR). The headline US growth number. Above 2% = solid, above 3% = strong, below 0% for 2 consecutive quarters = recession.

us_cpi.name: US CPI YoY
us_cpi.description: Headline consumer price inflation, year-over-year. The Fed's dual mandate target is 2%. Above 3% = hawkish pressure, below 2% = rate cut runway. Drives gold, bonds, and dollar.

umich_sentiment.name: UMich Consumer Sentiment
umich_sentiment.name_zh: 密歇根消费者信心指数
umich_sentiment.description: University of Michigan consumer sentiment index. Below 60 = deep pessimism (recession risk), above 80 = confidence. A leading indicator: consumers cut spending before GDP falls.

bigtech_capex.name: Big Tech CapEx
bigtech_capex.name_zh: 大型科技公司资本开支
bigtech_capex.description: Combined capex of MSFT, GOOGL, AMZN, META, ORCL (quarterly). Rising = AI infrastructure buildout accelerating. Follow the capex, not the capex spenders.

growth_value.name: Growth / Value
growth_value.description: VUG/VTV ratio. Rising = growth stocks outperforming value, falling = value winning. A declining ratio signals rotation from tech/financial assets into real-economy sectors.

cap_equal.name: Cap-Weight / Equal-Weight
cap_equal.description: SPY/RSP ratio. Rising = mega-cap concentration winning, falling = market breadth broadening. A declining ratio means the average stock is outperforming the index.

atoms_bits.name: Atoms vs Bits
atoms_bits.description: Physical-economy ETFs (XLB+XLI+XLE+XME) vs digital-economy ETFs (IGV+WCLD). Rising = hard assets outperforming software/cloud. A sustained rise signals regime change from bits to atoms.

_total_mktcap.name: Total US Market Cap
_total_mktcap.description: Total US equity market capitalization (all sectors, Flow of Funds).

_nominal_gdp.name: Nominal GDP
_nominal_gdp.description: US nominal GDP (quarterly, seasonally adjusted annual rate).

cn_us_spread.name: China–US 10Y Spread
cn_us_spread.description: China 10Y minus US 10Y yield (in bp). Currently deeply negative: US must offer far higher yields to fund its debt. Becoming more negative = US fiscal pressure worsening, dollar weakness signal. Narrowing (less negative) = pressure easing. Also a CNY stability indicator: wide gap = capital outflow pressure on yuan.

buffett_indicator.name: Buffett Indicator
buffett_indicator.description: Total US equity market cap / GDP. Warren Buffett's preferred valuation gauge. Historical average ~80%. Above 100% = overvalued. Currently near all-time highs: signals US equities priced for perfection.
